meanings.definition: To fill (something, such as a tire or balloon) with air or gas again.
meanings.sent1: After the tire went flat, I had to reinflate it to continue driving.
meanings.sent2: Remember to reinflate the balloon before the party starts.
meanings.sent3: I had to reinflate the beach ball multiple times because it kept losing air.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project helped reinflate my motivation.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the pump working hard to reinflate the tire was reassuring.

meanings.definition: To restore to a previous level or state of inflation.
meanings.sent1: The government's efforts to reinflate the economy were successful.
meanings.sent2: He tried to reinflate the basketball to its original size.
meanings.sent3: I had to reinflate my ego after receiving harsh criticism.
meanings.sent4: Her words of encouragement helped reinflate my confidence.
meanings.sent5: The memories of our happy times together helped reinflate my spirits.
